page.title: 12Benarty Community Centre
page.content: Since its opening in January 1985, the centre has offered a wide variety of activities to all age groups. Some examples are, playgroup, unemployed club, family night, youth clubs and very many more. The cafe, run by volunteers is fast becoming the social centre of the community. One of the most significant develop- ments the centre has produced is a change in the attitudes of the local people. There is a new spirit of enth- usiasm in the area. People are more willing and anxious to try new things. They have discovered skills, abilities and talents that they hadn't realised before.The general feeling is that the centre has brought about a significant improvement in the lives of local people:"This centre is great, but it's not enough - let's try for more." Helen Barrie (Community Leader)
